title: Documentation on rune built-in type is outdated
body:
by **anthony.eufemio**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Documentation for built-in rune type is incorrect:

From go/src/pkg/builtin/builtin.go (Lines 85-87)

// rune is an alias for int and is equivalent to int in all ways. It // used, by
convention, to distinguish character values from integer // In a future version of Go,
it will change to an alias of int32.
type rune rune

What is the expected output?
rune is already an alias of int32

What do you see instead?
In a future version of Go, it will change to an alias of int32.

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?


Which operating system are you using?
Linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go1.0.2
